definition: to profit from a disaster (idiom); some good comes out of a setback/It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good.
old variant of 因[yin1]
cause/reason/because
old variant of 禍|祸[huo4]
disaster/misfortune/calamity
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
good fortune/happiness/luck
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]

sentences.english: It is such a blessing in disguise that he got the love from the gal.
sentences.chinese: 不过却因祸得福得到了受他帮助的那个女孩的爱。

sentences.english: Mother and daughter survived because the mother did the right thing for the wrong reasons.
sentences.chinese: 母女俩幸存下来是因为那位母亲因祸得福。

sentences.english: Being laid-off from that job turned out to be a blessing in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 从那个工作中被解雇，结果却成了一件因祸得福的事。

sentences.english: Being cut loose was a blessing in disguise.
sentences.chinese: 被开除对我来说是因祸得福。

definition: to just escape from calamity
to succeed by a lucky stroke
the old man lost his mare, but it all turned out for the best (idiom); fig. a blessing in disguise/it's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
pinyin: sai4 weng1 shi1 ma3 yan1 zhi1 fei1 fu2

definition: one is bound for good fortune after surviving a great disaster (proverb)
pinyin: da4 nan4 bu4 si3 , bi4 you3 hou4 fu2

definition: accidentally/to act before thinking
lit. to try to steal a chicken only to end up losing the rice used to lure it (idiom)/fig. to try to gain an advantage only to end up worse off/to go for wool and come back shorn
pinyin: tou1 ji1 bu4 cheng2 shi2 ba3 mi3

definition: to be more scared than hurt (idiom)/to get through a daunting experience without mishap
thanks to/luckily
worthy of celebration/gratifying/Congratulations!
virtuous achievements come to their successful conclusion (idiom)
to miscalculate/miscalculation
mortal danger, escape alive (idiom); a narrow escape/to survive by the skin of one's teeth
God's plans supersede our own/Man proposes but God disposes
pinyin: ren2 suan4 bu4 ru2 tian1 suan4

definition: (idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
to have good luck/lucky/in luck
fortune/luck/fate
